title: High-waisted geometric sans serif
content:
I found this one on the [teaser poster](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054325/http:/www.impawards.com/2015/focus.html) for _Focus_. Besides the very high waist of the B, G, P & R the awkward W and narrow M throw me off. Looks like either a vintage geometric sans or a freeware/Google font.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054325im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Focus_type_4515.jpg)

Font: 

 Biko 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054325/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Focus\_type.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054325/http:/typophile.com/files/Focus_type.jpg) | 30.68 KB |
author: Bald Condensed

comments.content: I already looked at some digitisations of Edward Johnston’s Underground alphabet and some engraved sans serifs like Sackers etc.
Thank you. I didn’t know this one. :)

I referenced this one mainly because of [Brown](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054325/http:/lineto.com/The%20Fonts/Font%20Categories/Text%20Fonts/Brown) LL.  
Don recently initiated a discussion on ' [High Waist R sans-serif with straight leg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054325/http:/typophile.com/node/123153)' where, among many others, both Brown and Biko are listed.
